**INSTITUTION PALLIATIVE CARE PROGRESS NOTE - - - - - DATE: **DATE[Nov 02 2009] - - - - - Chief Complaint: lots of problems in the world - - - - - SUBJECTIVE SYMPTOMS Physical: no complaints when aske if he is comfortable. States abdomen is sore but it is manageable. + liquid bms Family Issues: family meeting **DATE[Nov 1 2009] with hope of transfer to Windber hospice then possibly home - - - - - Medications: Oral morphine equivalent: 2 mg IV-->6 po; Rounding Report: ACTIVE INPATIENT MEDICATION ORDERS ampicillin-sulbactam (Unasyn) 3gm IV Q12H balsam Peru/castor oil/trypsi... 1Application Topically BID calcium acetate (PhosLo Gelcap... 1,334mg By Mouth TIDmeals daptomycin 500mg IV Q48H digoxin 0.25mg By Mouth Q36H ergocalciferol 10,000IU By Mouth QMndWed hydrocortisone (hydrocortisone so...) 50mg IV Q8H insulin regular (HumuLIN R, NovoLIN... 0-28 Units subQ Q6H lactulose 20gm By Mouth Q12H lansoprazole (Prevacid) 30mg NG Tube Daily levothyroxine 175mcg By Mouth Daily midodrine (Proamatine) 10mg By Mouth BID octreotide 100mcg + NOTE 100mcg 100mcg subQ TID paroxetine (Paxil) 10mg By Mouth QPM rifaximin (Xifaxan) 400mg By Mouth TID risperidone (Risperdal) 0.25mg By Mouth AtBedtime sodium Rectum QID lidocaine 1% (lidocaine 1% injecta..... 3mL Misc As DirCPOE risperidone (Risperdal) 0.25mg By Mouth Q6H ONE TIME MED ORDERS 4/01 15:45morphine 2mg IV ONCE - - - - - GENERAL EXAM - Only document those organ systems that are medically necessary ----- General Appearance: No acute distress; lying in bed Skin: + dry skin on face around eyebrows HEENT: Hearing grossly normal; EOMI; duotube in place Lymph: Not Examined Pulmonary: CTA Cardiac: No murmur; No rubs; No gallops Abdomen: Soft; BS Present Extremeties: No edema; No erythema Neuro: alert and interactive Psych: confused Musculoskeletal: Not Examined Genitalia: Not Examined Rectal/Pelvic: Not Examined Breasts: Not Examined - - - - - INVESTIGATION - - - - - Labs: no recent - - - - - Rounding Report: MCV 91.1 RDW 24.4 C Platelets 99 L PT 23.3 H INR 2.0 H PTT 32.5 **DATE[Nov 02] 00:16 Glucose (bedside) 197 H **DATE[Nov 01] 20:17 Glucose (bedside) 170 H **DATE[Nov 01] 17:53 Glucose (bedside) 180 H Glucose 164 H Ca 8.5 Mg 2.1 Phos 3.9 WBC 14.8 H RBC 3.21 L Hgb 9.5 L Hct 28.9 L MCV 90.0 RDW 25.5 C Platelets 93 L Neutrophils 92 H Lymphs 4 L Monocytes 4 Eosinophils 0 Basophils 0 Type of Differential Automated Differential PT 24.6 H INR 2.1 H PTT 34.1 **DATE[Oct 31] 23:40 Glucose (bedside) 156 H **DATE[Oct 31] 17:32 Glucose (bedside) 214 H **DATE[Oct 31] 11:46 Glucose (bedside) 128 H MICROBIOLOGY: FUNGUS CULTURE(Ascites fluid) 3/04. Culture: NO FUNGUS ISOLATED [Final] GT Prophylaxis:Lansoprazole ASSESSMENT AND PLAN Assessment: ESLD secondary to PSC. Goals of care have transoitioned to comfort with goal of transfer tio inpt hospice facilty closer to home to help i - - - - - Problem/Diagnosis 1: 293.0: Delirium, d/t conditions classified elsewhere; multifactorial: prolonged hospitalization, hepatic failure, recovering sepsis; Assessment/Plans: may continue lactulose if the burdens of taking them are not too high. Continue risperidal. Problem/Diagnosis 2: Goals of care; Assessment/Plans: If curent QOl is not acceptable: would stop octreotide, midodrine. d/c duotube and monitor. Would convert steroids to po. Would stop Abx prior to transfer ( done with course tomorrow). Could discontinue calcium and zinc, vitamin D. Discontinue all meds that are not helping him have an ok QOL - - - - - RECOMMENDATIONS Other: Discussed with dr. **NAME[XXX]. I will call **NAME[VVV UUU] MD and give report. - - - - - ATTENDING PHYSICIAN SIGNATURE: Electronically signed by **NAME[YYY ZZZ], MD (Epic# 18735) at 10:02; **NAME[ZZZ, YYY] ?; 2177/8511; **DATE[Nov 2 2009]; 10:02 - - - - - VISIT CODE(S): 99233 - - - - -
